glsa.title: Asterisk: SIP Denial of Service
glsa.synopsis: Asterisk is vulnerable to Denial of Service in the SIP channel.

background.p: Asterisk is an open source implementation of a telephone private branch exchange (PBX).

description.p: The MU Security Research Team discovered that Asterisk contains a NULL-pointer dereferencing error in the SIP channel when handling request messages.

impact.p: A remote attacker could cause an Asterisk server listening for SIP messages to crash by sending a specially crafted SIP request message.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Asterisk users should upgrade to the latest version:
Note: Asterisk 1.0.x is no longer supported upstream so users should consider upgrading to Asterisk 1.2.x.
